verb.description: (of a liquid) spill or flow over the edge of a container, typically as a result of careless handling.
examples: water slopped over the edge of the sink

verb.description: Feed slops to (an animal, especially a pig).
Speak or write in a sentimentally effusive manner; gush.

noun.description: Waste water from a kitchen, bathroom, or chamber pot that has to be emptied by hand.

examples: country music is not all commercial slop

origin: Late Middle English (in slop (sense 1)): from the second element of Old English oferslop surplice, of Germanic origin.
